table.name: Creating a Monster Stat Block; Creature Reactions

tables.caption: Defensive Reactions
rows: Reduce the damage of a ranged weapon attack.
{@creature Aeorian absorber|egw}, {@creature core spawn seer|egw}, {@creature goliath warrior|idrotf}, {@creature lizardfolk scaleshield|gos}, {@creature master thief|vgm}
Reduce damage of an attack or spell effect.
Cause nearby creatures to be {@condition frightened}.
{@creature Booyahg slave of the archfey|vgm}, {@creature gloom weaver|mtf}, {@creature warlock of the archfey|vgm}
Turn {@condition invisible} and teleport up to 60 feet, remaining {@condition invisible} until the start of the next turn.
{@creature Golgari shaman|ggr}, {@creature star spawn larva mage|mtf}

{@creature Aurelia|ggr}, {@creature bandit captain}, {@creature blood drinker vampire|ggr}, {@creature death knight}, {@creature drow elite warrior}, {@creature drow house captain|mtf}, {@creature erinyes}, {@creature githyanki kith'rak|mtf}, {@creature githyanki supreme commander|mtf}, {@creature gladiator}, {@creature hobgoblin warlord}, {@creature hundred-handed one|mot}, {@creature knight}, {@creature marilith}, {@creature noble}, {@creature steel defender|tce}, {@creature summer eladrin|mtf}
Add AC to an attack that would hit.
{@creature Amnizu|mtf}, {@creature goblin boss}, {@creature enchanter|vgm}, {@creature star spawn seer|mtf}, {@creature Zuggtmoy|mtf}
Redirect an attack to another creature.

tables.caption: Offensive Reactions
rows: Make an attack of opportunity against a creature that moves into range.
{@creature Duergar warlord|mtf}, {@creature pirate captain|gos}, {@creature war priest|vgm}
Increase an attacking ally's accuracy or damage.
Move up and attack if there is a target within range.
Make an attack against a creature that starts its turn within range.
In response to a missed attack, disarm a creature.

{@creature Bloodfray giant|ggr}, {@creature construct spirit|tce} (clay form), {@creature gray render|mtf}, {@creature khargra|mff}, {@creature minotaur living crystal statue|gos}, {@creature norker|mff}, {@creature reckoner|ggr}, {@creature tanarukk|vgm}, {@creature the lost|mtf}, {@creature white abishai|mtf}, {@creature winter eladrin|mtf}
Damage or attack an enemy when hit.
Explode, dealing damage to nearby creatures.
Cause the creature to split in half, creating two new creatures in its place, halving its original hit points.
When an ally is reduced to 0 hit points, make an attack.

tables.caption: Support Reactions
rows: Cause oneself to be hit instead of a nearby ally.
{@creature Guardian giant|ggr}, {@creature shield guardian}, {@creature stone defender|mtf}, {@creature warforged soldier|erlw}
Cause an attack towards a nearby ally to have disadvantage, or other penalty.
Impose advantage or disadvantage on a creature's d20 roll.

table.name: Events
rows: A meteor shoots across the sky.
A strange star appears in the sky.
A strong gust of wind blows through.
Someone has a sense of foreboding.
Someone has to go to the bathroom.
Something spills or falls to the ground.
Something isn't where it's supposed to be.
There's a foul smell in the air.

makebrewCreatureTrait.name: Minion Perseverance
entries: If the minion is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The bee can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the bee fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Rotting Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) piercing damage, plus 13 ({@damage 2d12}) necrotic damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} until the start of the bee's next turn. While {@condition poisoned} in this way, a creature has vulnerability to all bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.

action.name: Bilic Discharge {@recharge 5}
entries: The bee projects a stream of rotten flesh and meat from its mouth in a line 15 feet long and 5 feet wide. Each creature in the line must succeed on a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw or be covered in this bile for 1 minute, or until a creature (including the target) uses their action to scrape it off of the affected target. At the start of each of its turns, a creature covered in the bile must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or spend its action that turn retching and reeling. Creatures that don't need to breathe or are immune to poison automatically succeed on this saving throw.

bonus.name: Pheromonal Fervor
entries: The bee picks up to three allied swarms within 60 feet that can see it. The chosen creatures can each use their reactions to make a single melee attack.

legendary.name: Flight
entries: The bee flies up to half its flying speed.

legendary.name: Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The bee makes a melee attack.

legendary.name: Wing Blitz (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The bee buzzes its wings. Each creature within 10 feet of the bee must succeed  on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or take 8 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) thunder damage. Also on a failure, a creature can't take reactions this turn. The bee can then fly up to half its flying speed.
Lair Actions:
The bee calls forth 3 ({@dice 1d6}) {@creature swarm of wasps||swarms}, appearing in locations of the bee's choice within 60 feet.
The bee causes the effects of the {@spell insect plague} ({@dc 15}), which lasts for 1 round.
The bee causes the effects of the {@spell shadow of moil|xge}, which lasts for 1 round, and takes the form of a thick blanket of bees that deal piercing damage.
Regional Effects:
Intense buzzing or grinding noises fill the region. With the exception of truly cacophonous sounds, creatures can only hear speech and noises that originate within 10 feet of them.
The region is choked with viscous honey, which acts as difficult terrain.
The air becomes filled with the stench of rotting flesh, and buzzing flies grow thick within the region, even when there is no carrion to be found.

monster.name: Undead Weave Serpent
languages: understands all languages it spoke in life but can't speak

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The serpent's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 14}, {@hit 6} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the devourer bone serpent fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The devourer bone serpent's weapon attacks are magical.

action.name: Chill Touch
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 6} to hit, range 120ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d8}) necrotic damage, and the target can't regain hit points until the start of the serpent's next turn.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}23 ({@damage 4d8 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Skeletal Rush {@recharge 5}
entries: The serpent moves up to its walking speed in a straight line and targets each creature within 5 feet of it during its movement. Each target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw or take 24 ({@damage 3d12 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Piercing Bones
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 1d12 + 5}) piercing damage, plus 18 ({@damage 4d8}) necrotic damage. Also on a hit, if the attack has advantage, the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 16}). Until this grapple ends, the creature is {@condition restrained}, and takes the necrotic damage of this attack at the start of each of its turns. Additionally, the target is shrouded in a veil of anti-magic, as if it were in an {@spell antimagic field} targetting only the creature. While a creature is {@condition grappled} this way, the serpent can't target another creature with this action.

bonus.name: Hallowed Trail {@recharge 6}
entries: Until the start of the serpent's next turn, it leaves a trail of {@hazard desecrated ground} in every space it passes through. Additionally, when a creature that isn't undead enters the area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or have its Strength score by {@dice 1d4}. A creature dies if this reduces its Strength to 0. Otherwise, the reduction lasts until the target finishes a short or long rest.

reaction.name: Spell Reflection
entries: If the serpent makes a successful saving throw against a spell, or a spell attack misses it, the serpent can choose another creature (including the spellcaster) it can see within 30 feet of it. The spell targets the chosen creature instead of the serpent. If the spell forced a saving throw, the chosen creature makes its own save. If the spell was an attack, the attack roll is rerolled against the chosen creature.

legendary.name: Cantrip
entries: The serpent casts a cantrip.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The serpent moves up to half its speed.

legendary.name: Bite (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The serpent makes a bite attack.

trait.name: Gleaming Carapace
entries: The spider can dodge as a bonus action.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the crystal spider remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal crystalline formation, such as a gemstone deposit.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The spider makes three attacks: one with its bite, and two with its razor leg.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Razor Leg
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Brilliant Ray {@recharge 4}
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 5} to hit, range 60 ft., up to two targets. {@h}17 ({@damage 4d6 + 3}) radiant damage, and the target is {@condition blinded} until the end of the spider's next turn.

reaction.name: Reflective Prism
entries: When the spider takes radiant damage, it immediately recharges and uses its Brilliant Ray.

trait.name: Rampage
entries: When the gnoll reduces a creature to 0 hit points with a melee attack on its turn, the gnoll can take a bonus action to move up to half its speed and make a bite attack.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (2/Day)
entries: If the gnoll fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The gnoll makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or take 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) slashing damage.

legendary.name: Bite
entries: The gnoll makes a bite attack.

legendary.name: Charge
entries: The gnoll moves up to its speed.

legendary.name: Savage (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The gnoll makes a claw attack against each creature within 5 feet of it.
Gnolls celebrate their victories by performing demonic rituals and making blood offerings to Yeenoghu.

Sometimes the demon lord rewards his worshipers by allowing one of them to be possessed by a demonic spirit. Marked as Yeenoghu's favorite, the lucky recipient becomes a fang of Yeenoghu, the chosen of the Gnoll Lord. In much the same way Yeenoghu created the first gnolls, a hyena that feasts on a fang's slain foe undergoes a horrible transformation, becoming a full-grown adult gnoll. Depending on the number of hyenas in a region, a fang of Yeenoghu can lead to a startling increase in the gnoll population. Finding and killing the fang is the only way to keep that population in check.

entries.name: Gnolls
entries: Gnolls are feral humanoids that attack settlements along the frontiers and borderlands of civilization without warning, slaughtering their victims and devouring their flesh.

entries.name: Demonic Origin
entries: The origin of the gnolls traces back to a time when the demon lord Yeenoghu found his way to the Material Plane and ran amok. Packs of ordinary hyenas followed in his wake, scavenging the demon lord's kills. Those hyenas were transformed into the first gnolls, parading after Yeenoghu until he was banished back to the Abyss. The gnolls then scattered across the face of the world, a dire reminder of demonic power.

Gnolls rarely build permanent structures or craft anything of lasting value. They don't make weapons or armor, but scavenge such items from the corpses of their fallen victims, stringing ears, teeth, scalps, and other trophies from their foes onto their patchwork armor.

entries.name: Nomadic Destroyers
entries: Gnolls are dangerous because they strike at random. They emerge from the wilderness, plunder and slaughter, then move elsewhere. They attack like a plague of locusts, pillaging settlements and leaving little behind but razed buildings, gnawed corpses, and befouled land. Gnolls choose easy targets for their raids. Armored warriors holed up in a fortified castle will survive a rampaging gnoll horde unscathed, even as the towns, villages, and farms that surround the castle are ablaze, their people slaughtered and devoured.

entries.name: Thirst for Blood
entries: No goodness or compassion resides in the heart of a gnoll. Like a demon, it lacks anything resembling a conscience, and can't be taught or coerced to put aside its destructive tendencies. The gnolls' frenzied bloodlust makes them an enemy to all, and when they lack a common foe, they fight among themselves. Even the most savage orcs avoid allying with gnolls.

trait.name: Rampage
entries: When the gnoll reduces a creature to 0 hit points with a melee attack on its turn, the gnoll can take a bonus action to move up to half its speed and make a bite attack.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The gnoll makes two melee attacks with its spear or two ranged attacks with its longbow.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Spear
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage, or 6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage when used with two hands to make a melee attack.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage, and the target's speed is reduced by 10 feet until the end of its next turn. Additionally, the target must make a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw versus poison, taking 7 ({@damage 3d4}) poison damage on a failure, or half as much on a success.

Hunters are the stealthiest gnolls in a war band, and they put their talents to use on the battlefield in a number of ways. In the vanguard of a war band, hunters creep around, picking off isolated opposition while clearing the way for the rest of the force to run roughshod over the enemy's territory.

Hunters are particularly skilled with the longbow, and they fire arrows with viciously barbed heads. Even when a hunter doesn't kill its target with its first shot, the arrow strike brings so much pain that the victim is hobbled in its attempt to run away. When a hunter on the prowl finds prey and isn't concerned about remaining stealthy, it sounds a horn crafted from bone that produces a keening wail similar to a banshee's yell.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The illusionist is a 7th-level spellcaster. its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks). The illusionist has the following wizard spells prepared:

trait.name: Displacement (Recharges after the Illusionist Casts an Illusion Spell of 1st Level or Higher)
entries: As a bonus action, the illusionist projects an illusion that makes the illusionist appear to be standing in a place a few inches from its actual location, causing any creature to have disadvantage on attack rolls against the illusionist. The effect ends if the illusionist takes damage, it is {@condition incapacitated}, or its speed becomes 0.

trait.name: Low Cunning
entries: The xvart can take the Disengage action as a bonus action on each of its turns.

trait.name: Overbearing Pack
entries: The xvart has advantage on Strength (Athletics) checks to shove a creature if at least one of the xvart's allies is within 5 feet of the target and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Raxivort's Tongue
entries: The xvart can communicate with ordinary bats and rats, as well as giant bats and giant rats.

action.name: Quarterstaff
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 1} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}2 ({@damage 1d6 - 1}) bludgeoning damage, or 3 ({@damage 1d8 - 1}) bludgeoning damage if used with two hands.

Xvarts are cruel, cowardly humanoids spawned by a cowardly, renegade demigod. They have blue skin, vivid orange eyes, and receding hairlines, mirroring their creator's appearance. They stand about 3 feet tall.

Xvarts live in remote hills, forests, and caves. Each tribe is led by a speaker, who is usually the brightest one among them. The speaker serves as the tribe's ambassador, and often dons short wooden stilts and heavy robes to look taller and more imperious. The rest of the tribe hunts for food, plundering crops and livestock from nearby farms if the hunt goes poorly. Xvarts aren't much of a threat to civilized locations because they are somewhat fearful of humans, dwarves, and elves.

entries.name: Raxivort's Betrayal
entries: All xvarts are the degenerate offspring of an entity named Raxivort, who once served Graz'zt the Dark Prince as treasurer. Raxivort spent long centuries watching over the treasury, and in time he grew to lust after his master's riches. In one bold move, he plundered a treasure vault and fled to the Material Plane. One of the treasures he stole was the Infinity Spindle, a crystalline shard from the early days of the multiverse that could transform even a creature as low as Raxivort into a demigod.

After he ascended to godhood, Raxivort forged a realm called the Black Sewers, within Pandesmos, the topmost layer of Pandemonium. He enjoyed his divine ascension only briefly, though, before Graz'zt unleashed his vengeance. The demon prince had no need to regain the Infinity Spindle, since he already possessed power greater than what it could grant. Instead, he dispatched agents far and wide to spread news of what the spindle could do and the puny, pathetic creature that claimed its ownership. Soon enough, Raxivort was pursued by a variety of enemies, all eager to claim the Spindle as their own.

In the face of his imminent destruction, Raxivort hatched a plan. Fleeing to the Material Plane, he wandered across a variety of worlds and spawned creatures that were his exact duplicate. These are the xvarts, creatures that not only look identical to Raxivort in appearance but also foil any magic used to track him down. Spells, rituals, and other effects that could reveal Raxivort's location instead point to the nearest xvart.

Although the initial rush of enemies against him has subsided, Raxivort knows that the planar powers are patient. He remains in hiding, a wretch of a demigod who does little more than wander the planes, spawning ever more xvarts to ensure his continued safety.
When things go badly for them, they kidnap whoever's handy and sacrifice them to their craven god. Hmm. I guess they're not so different from a lot of humans, after all.
-Volo

Despite their muddled nature, all xvarts have an unshakable devotion to Raxivort. The desire to please Raxivort weighs heavily on all their decisions. When things aren't going well for them, xvarts naturally assume that Raxivort is angry. To appease their troubled lord, they stage kidnappings. They fashion nets to capture their enemies, which are dragged back to the lair and sacrificed on a makeshift altar. Raxivort can hear their supplications, but he's too afraid to come out of hiding most of the time. Occasionally, he does appear before a tribe of worshipers as a 9-foot-tall xvart carrying an empty sack. In every such instance, Raxivort takes all of the treasure that the tribe has accumulated, stuffs it in his sack, and disappears, leaving nothing behind as compensation.
Xvart Speakers

A xvart tribe has one speaker that serves as its leader. The speaker has the statistics of a normal xvart, except that it has an Intelligence of 13 (+1) and knows one additional language (usually Common or Goblin).

entries.name: Greedy Thugs
entries: Xvarts have all of their creator's flaws and few redeeming qualities. They lack the physical equipment to reproduce, as well as the inclination to do so. They are greedy, conniving, and obsessed with the acquisition of valuables-the more ornate or bizarre, the better. They know they are flawed, and this minor amount of self-awareness only magnifies their other deficiencies . They hate almost any creature they perceive as better than they are, which includes almost anyone, but they lack the courage or wherewithal to act on their hatred most of the time. Their fear has led them to dwell either in gloomy places on the far fringes of civilized lands or in areas neglected or forgotten by mightier creatures. In other words, xvarts usually live in places where normal vermin might flourish.

entries.name: Vermin Masters
entries: Rats and bats (including giant-sized specimens) are naturally attracted to xvarts, and xvarts domesticate such beasts for food and battle. Xvarts also form alliances with wererats, although the lycanthropes are dominant in any such arrangement. This relationship traces back to Raxivort's divine nature. Even though the xvarts inherited Raxivort's greed and cowardice, they also gained his ability to form bonds with such creatures.

entries.name: Xvart Warlocks
entries: A xvart can forge a pact with Raxivort by stealing an item of such great value that the demigod himself appears before the xvart to claim it. After surrendering the item to Raxivort, the xvart asks for magical power so that it can find and deliver more great treasures into Raxivort's custody. If the demigod feels so inclined, he imbues the xvart with greater wisdom and charisma and grants it the spellcasting abilities of a warlock before returning to the howling chaos of

entries.name: Pandemonium
entries: Raxivort's warlocks are respected and feared in xvart society, but they have little interest in political power. They scour the wilderness, old ruins, and dungeons for treasures, often with a handful of xvart sycophants and giant rat bodyguards in tow.

trait.name: Cunning Action
entries: On each of its turns, the xvart can use a bonus action to take the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action.

trait.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
entries: The xvart deals an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the xvart that isn't {@condition incapacitated} and the xvart doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

trait.name: Overbearing Pack
entries: The xvart has advantage on Strength (Athletics) checks to shove a creature if at least one of the xvart's allies is within 5 feet of the target and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Raxivort's Tongue
entries: The xvart can communicate with ordinary bats and rats, as well as giant bats and giant rats.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The xvart makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Scimitar
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Dart
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Dream Venom Dart {@recharge 3}
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage, and the target is forced to make a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, the xvart is {@condition invisible} to the creature until the start of the xvart's next turn.
